subject: Psychology
title: Implicit Bias
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Implicit Bias.

hook.text: You believe you're not biased. But a reaction-time test reveals associations you didn't know you had.

buildup.text: Implicit biases are automatic associations between groups and traits that operate below conscious awareness.

discovery.text: The Implicit Association Test (IAT) measures response speed. Faster pairings reveal stronger unconscious associations.

twist.text: Having implicit bias doesn't make you a bad person. It means your brain absorbed cultural patterns. Everyone has them.

climax.text: Awareness of implicit bias is the first step. Structured decision-making processes can reduce its influence.

punchline.text: The biases you don't know you have shape decisions the most.

quiz.question: What does the Implicit Association Test measure?
options: Automatic unconscious associations between groups and traits
